definition: to shift one's eyes/(fig.) to shift one's attention/to divert attention
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to move/to shift/to change/to alter/to remove
to look at/to regard/to inspect
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Looking away from people or yawning will, in most cases, make me appear to be uninterested .
sentences.chinese: 轉移視線或不停地打哈欠大多說明這個人不感興趣。

sentences.english: He averts his eyes from the terrible sight.
sentences.chinese: 他轉移視線不看那可怕的景象。

sentences.english: Casino at's Western media for you, diverting attention.
sentences.chinese: 這就是西方的媒體，在轉移視線。

sentences.english: After the demonstration, as Israel accused Syria to divert attention.
sentences.chinese: 示威發生後，以色列指責敘利亞以此轉移視線。

sentences.english: From time to time, she would take her eyes' off the book and reach up to touch his wrinkled cheek.
sentences.chinese: 她時不時的從書上轉移視線擡起頭來碰到他褶皺的臉。

sentences.english: That's Western media for you, diverting attention.
sentences.chinese: 這就是西方的媒體，在轉移視線。

sentences.english: Honest people sometimes avert their gaze when they are telling the truth.
sentences.chinese: 誠實的人有時候會在說真話的時候轉移視線。

sentences.english: The political instability that results from depression makes war an attractive option to divert attention.
sentences.chinese: 由蕭條導致的政治上的不穩定將引發戰爭以轉移視線。

definition: to obscure the facts (idiom); to mislead the public with prevarication and deliberate falsehoods
to fight back/to return fire/to counterattack
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
complete nonsense (idiom)
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
making a deer out to be a horse (idiom); deliberate misrepresentation
shield/(fig.) excuse
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
riffraff/scum/lowlife/despicable/inferior
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
frightening words to scare people (idiom); alarmist talk/reds under the beds
crafty plots and machinations (idiom)
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to defend sb (a relative, friend or oneself) despite knowing that that person is in the wrong
to demand repayment
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
